item.title: US Consumers Have Some $500 Billion of Excess Savings to Spend
item.description: According to a recent report by the San Francisco Federal Reserve, US households still have approximately $500 billion in excess savings compared to before the COVID-19 pandemic. This surplus could support consumer spending late into this year and beyond. The Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco estimated that there is still a significant amount of excess savings in the economy, which is over and above what people would normally save.
